function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Activities with increased particle emission raise the risk of covid-19 transmission"},{"name":"Inadequate separation of heat and contaminants in displacement ventilation systems"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to poor indoor air quality iaq"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation rates for controlling infection probability"},{"name":"Dependence on mechanical ventilation systems for indoor air quality control"},{"name":"Potential airborne transmission of sars-cov-2 in indoor environments due to inadequate ventilation and overcrowding"},{"name":"Potential spread of covid-19 due to inadequate iaq measures"},{"name":"Dependence on open windows for high ventilation rates"},{"name":"Contaminated air not effectively removed"},{"name":"Ineffective sterilization of air"},{"name":"Inadequate distribution of treated air"},{"name":"Use of ineffective air filters"},{"name":"Improper installation of air filters"},{"name":"Inadequate maintenance of air filters"},{"name":"Use of hepa filters and pre-filters in built environments"},{"name":"Use of electrostatic smoke precipitators esp and electrostatic air filters es in built environments"},{"name":"Dependence on air conditioning systems for thermal comfort"},{"name":"Inadequate review of construction, design, and maintenance of hvac systems"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air supply in buildings"},{"name":"Use of ozone generators, electrostatic precipitators, and ionizers"},{"name":"Possible spread of epidemic through air conditioning systems"},{"name":"Expense of negative-pressure mechanical ventilation"},{"name":"Limited use of upper-room uv light in healthcare facilities"},{"name":"Exhaust vents positioned in the lower part of the room may lead to air contamination and increased risk of disease transmission."},{"name":"Wire mesh floors in animal cages may not effectively prevent faecal-oral transmission of tb."},{"name":"Ineffective sterilization and exhaust of air may lead to contamination and disease spread"},{"name":"Imbalanced airflow between animal enclosures"},{"name":"Inadequate positioning or installation of uv fixtures leading to occupant over-exposure"},{"name":"Lack of safety measures leading to adverse uv effects on patients and staff"},{"name":"Inadequate uv intensity due to lack of maintenance and degradation of uv bulbs."},{"name":"Unclear guidelines for upper-room uv installation and maintenance, leading to ineffective use."},{"name":"Lack of effective air mixing in patient rooms"},{"name":"Adverse effect of increasing relative humidity on uv germicidal efficacy"},{"name":"Higher ion densities achieved in poultry studies may not be applicable to healthcare environments, reducing the effectiveness of ionizers in preventing tb transmission."},{"name":"Accumulation of potentially infectious particles onto adjacent surfaces or grounded parts of the ionizer, leading to localized outbreak of tb-infected animals and potential risk of transmission to humans."},{"name":"Static charge interference with medical equipment due to ionizers, potentially leading to malfunctions or hazards in medical equipment."},{"name":"Inadequate cleaning and handling of the ionizers leading to potential contamination"},{"name":"Potential differences in ionizer effect on tb transmission between ward and animal facility"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in indoor settings"},{"name":"Impact of occupant presence and actions opa on total energy use in buildings"},{"name":"Reduced occupancy in buildings during lockdown"},{"name":"Equipment left in stand-by mode"},{"name":"Continuous operation of equipment such as refrigerators and stand-by plug loads in elementary and nursery schools"},{"name":"Uncertainty and variations in energy consumption may not be considered in the eui estimation model, leading to discrepancies between estimated and actual values."},{"name":"Unnecessary stand-by plug loads, such as computers, contributing to high energy consumption"},{"name":"Unoccupied building leading to higher energy demand than necessary"},{"name":"Higher ventilation rates in buildings due to covid-19 increase energy use"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the return of activities leading to systems being left turned on in buildings."},{"name":"Residual energy consumption in net-positive buildings during lockdown periods"},{"name":"Reduced building occupancy during severe crisis"}]}
